channel.title: Craigslist on Lewwwk
channel.description: Recent content in Craigslist on Lewwwk

item.title: The parallels of Web 2.0 with the Open Source and Social Innovation threads
item.description:
::::: entry-content ::: {} The recent issue of the Open Source Business Review is all about Social Innovation{.zem_slink rel=“wikipedia”} – what appears to be a an experiment in seeing how these two memes both converge and diverge. (hat tip to Mark Surman for pointing me there).

At the same time, this convergence is not unique to those fields. The quotes below from a recent post by Brad Burnham{.zem_slink rel=“crunchbase”} at Union Square Ventures{.zem_slink rel=“homepage”} point to some very strong parallels to the content in some of the pieces in the Open Source Business Review.
